books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.

books.title: Tarzan, Lord of the Jungle
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: Journeys, times, and cultures collide as two expeditions seek the riches of known and fabeled lands.

books.title: Geronimo’s Story of His Life
books.author: Geronimo
books.summary: The Apache war chief Geronimo recounts the story of his life.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Beatrix Potter
books.summary: A collection of Beatrix Potter’s short stories for children, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Leave It to Psmith
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Psmith inveigles himself into Blandings Castle to help out a friend and to pursue love.

books.title: Henry V
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Shakespeare’s 1599 play chronicling the history of King Henry the Fifth and his famous victory over the French at the Battle of Agincourt.

books.title: Wet Magic
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: A group of children visiting the seaside free a captive mermaid and visit her domain.

books.title: Mystery at Lynden Sands
books.author: J. J. Connington
books.summary: A Chief Constable’s holiday on the coast is interrupted when he is drawn into investigating a murder.

books.title: Frankenstein
books.author: Mary Shelley
books.summary: A tragic scientist creates a monster in his laboratory.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.

books.title: The Insidious Dr. Fu-Manchu
books.author: Sax Rohmer
books.summary: An intrepid detective hunts the criminal mastermind Fu-Manchu through early 20th-century London.

books.title: Liberalism
books.author: L. T. Hobhouse
books.summary: An early twentieth century description of the philosophy of liberal socialism.

books.title: Tractatus Logico-Philosophicus
books.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
books.summary: One of the most important texts of 20th century philosophy, in which the nature of the philosophy, language, understanding, and logical atomism are explored.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s poetry.

books.title: The Indiscreet Jewels
books.author: Denis Diderot
books.summary: The Sultan of the Congo brings about philosophical inquiry and scandal when he is granted a magical ring that permits him to compel speech from the vaginas of the women of his court.

books.title: The Night Land
books.author: William Hope Hodgson
books.summary: A 17th-century gentleman is reincarnated on a far-future Earth where the sun has died, and scours the hellish landscape for his lost love.

books.title: Household Tales
books.author: Jacob Grimm
books.summary: A collection of Germanic fairy tales containing the classic stories of Cinderella, Snow-White, Rapunzel, and other well known characters.

books.title: Paradise Lost
books.author: John Milton
books.summary: A dramatic imagining in blank verse of the rebellion of Satan against God, Satan’s overthrow, and the Fall of Man.

books.title: A Negro Explorer at the North Pole
books.author: Matthew Henson
books.summary: The self-told story of the black man who accompanied Robert Peary during the first trip to the North Pole.
